dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Chaudhry, S. 2010. Botia dario. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Chaudhry, S.

Reviewer/s
Rema Devi, K.R., Arunachalam, M., Dahanukar, N., Vishwanath, W., Daniel, B.A. & Molur, S.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification
Botia dario is the most common of all Botia species and is also very widespread. Although there are threats to its habitats and it is heavily harvested for ornamental trade, the species is hardy and is therefore assessed as Least Concern. If impacts of harvest and threats become apparent, this species must be evaluated accordingly in future.
